definitions: Put off (an action or event) to a later time; postpone.
Postpone the start of (something, especially military service) until a later time.
To delay or put off an action or decision.
To yield respectfully to another's opinion or judgment.
examples: The committee deferred its decision until the next meeting.
He deferred his enrollment for a year.
She deferred to her boss's expertise.
Payment has been deferred until next month.
